channel.title: Uncategorized – Ayesha Eats
channel.description: A medical student sharing her whole food adventures! Learn how I incorporate whole grains and whole foods into my diet!

item.title: Avocado Toast with Perfectly Runny Boiled Egg
item.dc:creator: Ayesha
item.description:
Tastes like a poached egg without the fuss! As my boyfriend described it – a very simple but supremely satisfying meal for any time of the day! Ingredients: 1 avocado 2 tbsp lemon juice 6 basil leaves ½ tsp garlic powder 1 tsbp chili flakes ¼ tsp salt 2 eggs 2 pieces of sprouted wheat …

Continue reading "Avocado Toast with Perfectly Runny Boiled Egg"
item.content:encoded:
Tastes like a poached egg without the fuss!

As my boyfriend described it – a very simple but supremely satisfying meal for any time of the day!

Ingredients:

1 avocado

2 tbsp lemon juice

6 basil leaves

½ tsp garlic powder

1 tsbp chili flakes

¼ tsp salt

2 eggs

2 pieces of sprouted wheat toast*

Instruction:

  1. Add 6inch of water to a small sauce pan and bring to boil. Add eggs and boil for 6min. Immediately immerse the eggs in cool water from the sink. Peel the eggs carefully.
  2. Toast your bread.
  3. Add avocado, lemon juice, torn basil leaves, garlic powder, chili flakes and salt to a bowl and mash together till as smooth as you like it.
  4. Put half of the avocado mixture on each piece of toast and add 1 egg that you cut in half on the toast since the yolk will be very runny. Enjoy!

*We love the Ezekiel brand.

item.title: Vegetarian Sushi
item.dc:creator: Ayesha
item.description:
Now, I know what you’re thinking. Vegetarian sushi is a misnomer. But I promise these are satisfying and use a whole grain (black rice instead of white) to boot! Makes: Enough rice to make 2 rolls.  Ingredients: Rice: ½ cup dry black rice 1 cup water 1tbsp rice vinegar 2tsp sugar 1/2tsp salt Omelette:  2tsp …

Continue reading "Vegetarian Sushi"
item.content:encoded:
Now, I know what you’re thinking. Vegetarian sushi is a misnomer. But I promise these are satisfying and use a whole grain (black rice instead of white) to boot!

Makes: Enough rice to make 2 rolls. 

Ingredients:

Rice:

½ cup dry black rice

1 cup water

1tbsp rice vinegar

2tsp sugar

1/2tsp salt

Omelette: 

2tsp oil

2 eggs

1/2tsp chili powder

1/2tsp turmeric

Salt to taste

Soy-Tahini Mushroom:

1tsp oil

8oz oyster mushrooms

1tbsp soy sauce

1tbsp tahini

1tbsp maple syrup

1tsp ginger paste

1tsp garlic paste

Other ingredients:

Seaweed 

Avocados

Cucumbers

Instructions:

Rice:

Add rice and water to a small sauce pan. Bring to boil. Then turn down heat, put on a lid and simmer for 30min.

Once the rice is cooked, add the white vinegar, sugar and salt and mix thoroughly. 

Omelette:

Whisk egg and all spices in a separate bowl. Heat a skillet to medium-high heat and add oil. Pour the egg mixture into the pan. Cook for 2min, flip and cook for 1min.

Soy-Tahini Mushrooms:

Heat a skillet to medium-high heat and add oil. Add mushrooms, ginger and garlic and saute for 5min. Add the soy sauce, tahini, maple syrup and saute for 5min.

Assembly:

Lay down a single seaweed sheet, put half of the rice and spread it out. Add any combination of fillings, then delicately roll and cut into 8 pieces per roll.

Serve with soy sauce and wasabi!
